business.headline: India coming to table: Trump aide Navarro's big claim ahead of Delhi trade talksIndia coming to table: Trump aide Navarrro's big claim day ahead of trade talks in Delhi

Markets close flat ahead of US Fed meet, GST 2.0 driving consumption boostA cautious session kept Indian equities flat, with investors eyeing the US Fed's decision. Experts, however, expect GST 2.0 reforms to drive domestic consumption and benefit core sectors such as FMCG and banking.
Sensex ends 119 points lower, Nifty below 25,100; Titan down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 118.96 points to end at 81,785.74, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 44.80 points to end at 25,069.20.

Income tax portal faces glitch on last day of ITR filing. Here's what to doAs the September 15, 2025 deadline ticks away, users have been facing serious issues like very slow page loading, errors in uploading forms, and repeated system failures while submitting their returns.

How Gen-Z is changing money habits, explains financial advisorGen-Z is shaking up traditional money habits. From saving to investing and spending on experiences, this generation is rewriting the rules of wealth. A financial advisor explains how and why.

Can GST relief on insurance turn first-time buyers into long-term policyholders?For millions of families who hesitated to buy insurance because of the extra tax burden, the recent GST reforms could be a turning point.

ITR 2025 deadline: Know penalties and benefits you lose for missing the due dateThe deadline to file Income Tax Returns (ITR) for 2025 is here, and missing it can cost more than just a late fee. From penalties to lost tax perks, here's what you need to know.

Advance tax deadline today: How much to pay and penalty for delayThe second instalment of advance tax for financial year 2026 is due on 15 September. Here's what individuals need to pay, who is liable, and the consequences of missing the deadline.

Looking for value-based stocks to buy on Dalal Street? Here are the top picksExperts believe the current market offers good opportunities, especially in sectors that have seen recent corrections and are expected to benefit from domestic demand, GST reforms, and a good monsoon.

ITR filing deadline today: Key FAQs for last-minute filersToday marks the final chance to file Income Tax Returns for AY 2025–26. As the deadline closes in, last-minute filers are rushing to the portal. Here are the answers to the most common questions.

Dev Accelerator IPO allotment today: Step-by-step guide to check status onlineThe share allotment for Dev Accelerator IPO was finalised on September 15, 2025. Investors can check their allotment status using official BSE or registrar websites following outlined procedures.
Sensex opens 54 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Eternal rises 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 57.17 points to 81,961.87, while the NSE Nifty50 added 5.35 points to 25,119.35 as of 9:26 am.

entertainment.headline: Real Kashmir Football Club: Zeeshan Ayyub-Manav Kaul lead inspiring sports dramaActors Zeeshan Ayyub and Manav Kaul star in 'Real Kashmir Football Club', a series inspired by the true story of Kashmir's first professional football team. The show highlights resilience, teamwork, and passion as two men and a group of rookies chase their sporting dreams against the odds.

The Wrong Paris review: This love story is glossy, cheeky, and worth the rideRelease Date:Fri Sep 12, 2025'The Wrong Paris', starring Miranda Cosgrove, Pierson Fode, is currently streaming on Netflix. Is the one-hour, 49-minute movie worth a watch? This review is all you need to find out.

Dhanush dances with son Linga, enjoys heartfelt moment at Idli Kadai event. WatchDhanush and his youngest son, Linga, danced on stage at the 'Idli Kadai' audio launch in Chennai. The actor-director performed a song with composer GV Prakash on stage.

Archana Puran Singh calls Yogita Bihani a worthy bahu after her stunning new lookAaryamann Sethi's family celebrated in style as fiancee Yogita Bihani debuted a trendy haircut, triggering playful banter and glowing praise from parents Archana Puran Singh and Parmeet Sethi.
How Shinchan became India's most loved naughty Japanese cartoonFrom banned cartoon to cultural icon, here's why 'Shinchan' still makes Indian viewers laugh, relate and rewind after two decades on TV.

Kichcha Sudeep will appear in a cameo in KD The Devil, makers confirmKannada star Kichcha Sudeep will be seen in a guest appearance in the upcoming film 'KD: The Devil', which stars Dhruva Sarja and Sanjay Dutt. The film, directed by Prem, features an ensemble cast and the announcement was made by KVN Productions onsocial media.

Too Much trailer: Kajol, Twinkle Khanna bring Bollywood's wild side backAre you ready for another celebrity chat show? If yes, then 'Too Much with Kajol and Twinkle Khanna' should be on your watchlist. Here's why?

Selena Gomez upset as Only Murders in the Building gets Emmy 2025 snubSelena Gomez made her first red carpet appearance with fiance Benny Blanco at the 2025 Emmys. The couple shared sweet moments as her show missed out on a win.

Mirai actor Teja Sajja names SRK as dream collaborator, discusses new projectTelugu actor Teja Sajja expressed interest in Hindi cinema while choosing to stay based in Hyderabad. In an exclusive interview with India Today, he praised dubbed films and hopes to work with Shah Rukh Khan in future projects.

Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari trailer: Pyaar Toh Hona Hi Tha ft. Varun-Janhvi'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' trailer: Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor shine in Shashank Khaitan's coluorful rom-com, but it seems like a modern twist reminiscent of the 1998 'Pyaar Toh Hona Hi Tha'.

Can't compare apples and oranges: Ameesha Patel on Saiyaara vs Kaho Naa Pyaar HaiAmeesha Patel praised Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's film 'Saiyaara' but said it should not be compared to her debut 'Kaho Naa Pyaar Hai', as both are very different. She added that Bollywood needs fresh faces and was happy to see Gen Z connect with 'Saiyaara'.

Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Baseer-Nehal end friendship amid romance rumoursBaseer Ali and Nehal Chudasama, one of the most talked-about pairs on 'Bigg Boss 19',  are no longer friends. The duo announced the end of their friendship on Weekend Ka Vaar, which was hosted by the 'Jolly LLB 3' team and Farah Khan.

After Abhishek-Aishwarya, KJo files plea for protection of his personality rightsFilmmaker Karan Johar has filed a petition in the Delhi High Court seeking protection of his personality rights. The development follows similar legal actions by Aishwarya Rai and Abhishek Bachchan, raising concerns over name misuse.

Disha Patani's sister Khushboo shares self-defence video days after firing incidentAfter a firing incident outside actor Disha Patani's Bareilly home, retired Army Major Khushboo Patani shared a self-defence video, demonstrating how simple items can be used for safety.

Ram Gopal Varma on Mirai: VFX Outshines Rs 400 crore films, action-like ritualsTeja Sajja's superhero film 'Mirai' is making waves at the box office, winning appreciation for its visuals, storyline, and VFX. Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma praised the film's effects, noting they surpassed those of several higher-budget projects.

Soha Ali Khan recalls being flashed in Italy: Apparently that happens oftenActor Soha Ali Khan shared that she was flashed in broad daylight during a trip to Italy, calling the incident disturbing. She also reflected on how her privileged background shielded her from many unsafe situations and even the casting couch in Bollywood.

Demon Slayer Infinity Castle box office Day 3: India records staggering 1st weekend'Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle' shattered records in India with a historic Rs 41 crore opening weekend, becoming the biggest non-Hollywood foreign film. The Japanese anime blockbuster is also breaking box office records worldwide.

Mariska Hargitay, Christopher Meloni reunite with Law & Order: SVU castThe stars of 'Law and Order: SVU' reunited at the 77th Emmy Awards on 14 September 2025, presenting the Outstanding Drama Series award and celebrating 35 years of the iconic franchise with light-hearted banter and tributes.

Tempest review: Jun Ji-hyun and Gang Dong-won headline a taut political spy dramaRelease Date:Wed Sep 10, 2025'Tempest' review: 'Tempest' is a political thriller focusing on a diplomat's wife navigating betrayal after an assassination. The series explores complex geopolitics and personal survival amid rising tensions.

general news.headline: Will scrap Bihar SIR exercise if...: Supreme Court's big warning to poll panelThe Supreme Court warned it will scrap Bihar's electoral roll revision if any illegality is detected, while setting October 7 for final arguments on the Election Commission's contested methodology.

Pakistan demands removal of match referee after India's handshake snubAsia Cup: Pakistan Cricket Board has demanded the removal of match referee Andy Pycroft, alleging violation of ICC Code of Conduct in match against India. The controversy erupted after Indian players refused to shake hands with the Pakistan side.

BMW driver took my husband to hospital 19 km away despite appeals: Victim's wifeThe victim, Navjot Singh, Deputy Secretary in the Department of Economic Affairs, was returning from Bangla Sahib Gurdwara with his wife Sandeep Kaur on Sunday afternoon when their motorcycle was hit by a speeding BMW near Dhaula Kuan on Ring Road.
India coming to table: Trump aide Navarro's big claim ahead of Delhi trade talksIndia coming to table: Trump aide Navarrro's big claim day ahead of trade talks in Delhi

The lost handshake: Theatrics and optics beat cricket at Asia CupThe Indian cricket team's refusal to shake hands with Pakistan after their Asia Cup turned the spotlight away from the game, forcing fans and players alike to confront the uneasy intersection of politics and play. The question remains: at what cost?

Supreme Court partly pauses Waqf Act as it prepares to hear pleas against itOn May 22, the Supreme Court reserved its interim order on the Act after arguments from the two sides for three straight days. The petitions filed challenge the constitutionality of the changes made to the Waqf law by amendments passed by Parliament earlier this year.

Why would anyone convert if Hinduism had equality: Siddaramaiah's remarks draw ireKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's remark on Hinduism and conversions triggered a political storm, with Opposition leaders, including R Ashoka and Chalavadi Narayanswamy, accusing him of dividing communities and pursuing political gains.

Deadline September 20, why mapping Bengal's voters is a race against timeThe EC's Special Intensive Revision, tallying 2002 and 2025 rolls, is daunting as West Bengal has 75,000-80,000 booths, with the number set to rise this year

New Pixel and iPhone are here, so is the beginning of an end for smartphonesAfter close to 20 years of glorious run, smartphones as technology have become stagnant and are ripe to be replaced with something else. At least that is the impression the latest Google Pixels and Apple iPhones offer given how incremental they are with their updates.

Boycott or not, few really care about India vs Pakistan anymoreAsia Cup 2025: Boycott or not, the India vs Pakistan rivalry is losing its edge. Once fiery underdogs, Pakistan now offer little resistance, and Sunday's defeat was yet another reminder that the contest is increasingly one-sided.

Tied, beaten, genitals stapled: Kerala couple arrested for torturing, robbing 2 menA Kerala couple allegedly tortured two men, forcing sexual acts, stapling their bodies and pepper-spraying genitals. They filmed one assault and robbed both victims. Police arrested them and are probing possible black-magic motives.

Your zodiac sign is out of date by 2,000 years. Here's the scienceModern astronomy tools show that many people's true astronomical sign could differ from their familiar zodiac sign by several days or even an entirely different sign.

Caught on CCTV: Brave nurses in Assam hospital shield babies during strong quakeThe CCTV footage was captured at around 4.40 pm in the Aditya Nursing Home, Nagaon, showing the two nurses immediately coming to the aid of the babies as the earthquake struck.

Income tax portal faces glitch on last day of ITR filing. Here's what to doAs the September 15, 2025 deadline ticks away, users have been facing serious issues like very slow page loading, errors in uploading forms, and repeated system failures while submitting their returns.

Delhi BMW crash: Finance ministry official killed, wife critical; accused arrestedThe finance ministry official and his wife were returning home after visiting Bangla Sahib Gurdwara when their bike was hit by a BMW. The man was killed in the accident while his wife was critically injured.

UK man arrested over racially motivated rape of Sikh womanPolice said the man, in his 30s, was detained on Sunday and remains in custody as part of their enquiries into the "racially motivated rape" in Oldbury, West Midlands region of England, reported last Tuesday.
Proof you're a true 90s kid: You read this in the 'Washing Powder Nirma' tuneCadbury once made us dance on cricket pitches; today's ads barely make us pause the scroll.

How loyalty, temptation stumped boycott as India clashed with PakDid Indians actually boycott Sunday's India-Pakistan T20 Asia Cup match? Though hashtags calling people to not watch the match trended, anecdotal evidence suggests otherwise. As Indians blamed the government and the BCCI for the match with Pakistan, they backed the Men in Blue and gave in to the temptation of watching a superior India team send Pakistanis packing.

Furious at wife over birthday party video, man shoots her dead on Gwalior streetA man in Gwalior shot his wife dead in broad daylight after seeing her Facebook birthday party video with a friend. The accused, Arvind Parihar, was arrested after pointing a pistol at police officers.

Did what felt right: Man who took BMW crash victim, his wife to hospital 19 km awayNavjot Singh, a senior Finance Ministry official, died after a speeding BMW driven by a woman hit his motorcycle near Delhi Cantonment area on Sunday night.
Massive asteroid bigger than Qutub Minar flying towards EarthFA22 follows a moderately elongated, slightly tilted orbit around the sun, with an orbital period of roughly 1.85 years.

Indians in UK are patriotic: British journalist's viral post amid anti-immigration stirBritish journalist Andrew Gold wrote about his encounter with an Indian restaurant owner, which led him to say that Indians in the UK are patriotic. The post comes after London witnessed its largest-ever protests against immigration.

Pakistan lodge protest against India players, match referee over handshake rowThe Pakistan cricket team has launched a formal protest against the Indian players for refusing to shake hands at the end of the match. The team has reportedly also lodged a complaint against the match referee Andy Pycroft.

Nothing wrong with transfer of temple elephants: Big top court relief for VantaraGiving Vantara a clean chit, the Supreme Court said that the transfer of temple elephants to Reliance Foundation's animal rescue and conservation center in Gujarat's Jamnagar is valid as long as due procedure is followed.

Mohammed Siraj wins ICC Player of the Month after Kennington Oval heroicsMohammed Siraj was named ICC Men's Player of the Month for August 2025 after a stunning nine-wicket haul at The Oval. His performance helped India level the series against England, highlighting his rising stature in international cricket.

Greatest-ever finish in marathon? World Athletics Championship race stuns fansWorld Athletics Championships: Was it a marathon or 100m sprint? Photo-finish at the men's event leaves fans stunned in Tokyo.

Rishabh Pant no longer in cast, walking comfortably after foot fracture: ReportRishabh Pant has made significant strides in his recovery. The wicketkeeper-batter no longer needs a cast and is walking comfortably. He is expected to travel to the BCCI's Centre of Excellence to begin training as he eyes a return in the West Indies home series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
